paper_id: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments

paper_metadata.title: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments
paper_metadata.primary_focus: Potassium balance and related changes in soil K fractions (bioavailable, exchangeable, non-exchangeable) under different long-term fertilization treatments in two distinct soil-climatic conditions.

research_methodology.experimental_design: Long-term stationary field experiments with 6 fertilization treatments and a fixed crop rotation (potatoes-winter wheat-spring barley), with all three crops grown each year. Soil samples were taken at the beginning and end of the 21-year period, and plant yields were collected annually.

temporal_scope.data_collection_frequency: Annual crop harvest; soil samples collected at the start (1996) and end (2017) of the experiment.
temporal_scope.seasonal_coverage: Fertilizer applications in autumn (organic, P, K) and spring (mineral N).
monitoring_timeline: 1996-2017: Annual crop harvest and yield data collection

site_characteristics: Hněvčeves: Haplic Luvisol on loess, Clay loam texture, 265 m a.s.l.
Humpolec: Stagnic Cambisol on loess on paragneiss, Sandy loam texture, 525 m a.s.l.
spatial_scope.regional_representativeness: The crop rotation corresponds well with intensive farming systems used in the Czech Republic.

sample_design.replication_levels: Four replications for soil samples; experimental plots are implied to be replicated for each treatment at each site.
sample_design.randomization_approach: Not explicitly stated, but implied by 'trials' and statistical analysis.
controls_and_treatments: FYM 1/2: Half dose of farmyard manure + mineral nitrogen (N)
N + ST: Straw of spring barley + mineral nitrogen (N)
sample_design.statistical_power: Not explicitly stated, but ANOVA was used to assess significance.

measurement_protocols: Soil sample preparation: Air-dried, ≤ 2 mm, 0–30 cm depth.
Plant sample preparation: Dried at 40°C, dry decomposition (Mader et al. 1998).
K content in plants: Atomic Adsorption Spectrometry (AAS).
Bioavailable K in soil: Mehlich 3 extraction (Mehlich 1984).
Bioavailable K in soil: CaCl2/DTPA (CAT) extraction (CSN EN 13651, 2001).
Exchangeable K (Kex) in soil: Ammonium acetate (NH4OAc) extraction (Haby et al. 1990 modified).
Non-exchangeable K (Kne) in soil: Boiling 1 mol/L HNO3 extraction (Helmke and Sparks 2000), subtracting NH4OAc-determined K.
instrumentation: Atomic Adsorption Spectrometry (AA280FS, Agilent Technologies, Mulgrave, Australia) for plant K.
Optical Emission Spectrometer with Inductively Coupled Plasma (ICP-OES, Agilent Technologies 700, Victoria, Australia) for soil K extracts.
quality_control: Soil samples analyzed from 1996 (before experiment) and 2017 (after 7th crop rotation).

statistical_approach.significance_testing: Significance level P < 0.001 for correlations; 'statistically significant differences' mentioned for treatment effects.
statistical_approach.uncertainty_quantification: Not explicitly quantified beyond statistical significance.
statistical_approach.model_validation: Not applicable (no models developed in this study).

primary_measurements.parameter: Potassium balance (inputs minus outputs) over 21 years
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Hněvčeves (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + St) and Humpolec (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + St) treatments. Maximum negative balance (-2376 kg K/ha) at Humpolec N treatment.

primary_measurements.parameter: Crop uptake of potassium (total over 21 years)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Hněvčeves (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + St) and Humpolec (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + St) treatments. Humpolec K uptake was 348 kg K/ha higher on average across all variants.
From farmyard manure (Hněvčeves, Humpolec) and mineral fertilizers (NPK) (Hněvčeves, Humpolec).
Average across all treatments at Hněvčeves and Humpolec, respectively. Hněvčeves was 31% higher.

primary_measurements.parameter: Exchangeable potassium content in plough layer (NH4OAc)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Average across all treatments at Hněvčeves and Humpolec, respectively. Hněvčeves was 34.6% higher.

primary_measurements.parameter: Saturation of potassium in cation exchange capacity
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Average across all treatments at Hněvčeves and Humpolec, respectively. Values > 3.50% CEC considered satisfactory.

primary_measurements.parameter: Potassium content in plough layer (CAT extraction)
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Average across all treatments at Hněvčeves and Humpolec, respectively. Significantly lower than other methods.

primary_measurements.parameter: Non-exchangeable potassium content in plough layer
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Average at Hněvčeves (Luvisol) and Humpolec (Cambisol), respectively. Range at Hněvčeves: 816-927 mg K/kg; Humpolec: 2908-3068 mg K/kg.

primary_measurements.parameter: Total K extracted by boiling HNO3
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Average at Hněvčeves and Humpolec, respectively. Represents 100% for comparison of extraction methods.

primary_measurements.parameter: Proportion of non-exchangeable K to total HNO3-extractable K
Changes in potassium content in plough layer (1996-2017) - Mehlich 3
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Hněvčeves (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) and Humpolec (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) treatments.

primary_measurements.parameter: Changes in potassium content in plough layer (1996-2017) - Kex
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Hněvčeves (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) and Humpolec (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) treatments.

primary_measurements.parameter: Changes in potassium content in plough layer (1996-2017) - CAT
primary_measurements.measurement_context: Hněvčeves (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) and Humpolec (Control, FYM 1, FYM 1/2, N, NPK, N + ST) treatments.

temporal_patterns.trend_description: Significant tendency to decrease at Hněvčeves site in variants without K fertilization.
Decreased in all unfertilized variants over 21 years. Highest decrease at mineral N fertilization.

comparative_results.practical_significance: Hněvčeves had higher average K content.
Hněvčeves had higher average K content.

comparative_results.comparison_type: Effect of manure application on exchangeable K
comparative_results.statistical_significance: Significant increase with manure, significantly lowest without K fertilization.
comparative_results.practical_significance: Manure application effectively increased exchangeable K.

comparative_results.comparison_type: K uptake by plants between sites
comparative_results.practical_significance: Higher K uptake at Humpolec despite lower bioavailable K, possibly due to higher precipitation and potato yield.
Humpolec (Cambisol on paragneiss) had much higher non-exchangeable K content (approx. 3000 mg K/kg) compared to Hněvčeves (Luvisol on loess) (approx. 850 mg K/kg), attributed to parent material.

geographic_details.elevation: Hněvčeves: 265 m a.s.l.; Humpolec: 525 m a.s.l.

climate_characteristics.climate_classification: Not explicitly classified, but described by temperature and precipitation.

precipitation_patterns.seasonality_Humpolec: Regular distribution throughout the vegetation period

climate_characteristics.growing_season: Not explicitly stated, but implied by crop rotation.

soil_properties.soil_classification: Hněvčeves: Haplic Luvisol; Humpolec: Stagnic Cambisol
soil_properties.texture: Hněvčeves: Clay loam; Humpolec: Sandy loam
soil_properties.mineralogy: Hněvčeves: on loess; Humpolec: on loess on paragneiss. Non-exchangeable K is bound mainly at boundaries of 2:1 clay minerals, mica and vermiculite.

growth_stages_studied: Winter wheat: BBCH 21 (first half of N dose), BBCH 31–32 (second half of N dose)

types: Mineral nitrogen fertilizers (calcium ammonium nitrate, 27% N)
Mineral phosphorus fertilizers (triple super phosphate, 21% P)
timing: Organic fertilizers (FYM, straw): Autumn (October) to potatoes.
Mineral P and K fertilizers: Autumn to each crop.
Mineral N fertilizers: Spring prior to crop establishment for potatoes and spring barley.
Mineral N fertilizers for winter wheat: Divided into halves, first at BBCH 21, second at BBCH 31–32.

input_rates.N_application_rates: 140 kg N/ha for wheat (115 kg N/ha for FYM 1/2); 70 kg N/ha for spring barley (50 kg N/ha for FYM 1/2); 120 kg N/ha for potatoes (165 kg N/ha total N in organic for FYM 1/2, 330 kg N/ha total N in organic for FYM 1)
input_rates.P_application_rates: 30 kg P/ha for NPK treatment (wheat and barley); others depend on organic fertilizers
input_rates.K_application_rates: 100 kg K/ha for NPK treatment (wheat and barley); others depend on organic fertilizers

data_collection_schedule: Soil sampling in autumn 1996 (before experiment) and after harvest 2017
study_timeline.monitoring_frequency: Annually for yields, twice for soil properties over 21 years.

seasonal_variations.seasonal_pattern: Organic and P/K fertilizers in autumn; mineral N in spring.

long_term_trends.sustainability_implications: Indicates depletion of K reserves in unfertilized Luvisol soils.
Highlights the need for K fertilization to maintain soil K levels, especially in unfertilized or N-only fertilized systems.

spatial_variability.site_differences: Significant differences in soil properties, climate, yields, and K dynamics between Hněvčeves and Humpolec.

drivers_of_variability: Soil type and parent material (Luvisol vs. Cambisol, loess vs. paragneiss)

methodological_strengths: Long-term (21 years) field experiment, providing valuable insights into long-term K dynamics.
Two sites with distinct soil and climatic conditions, allowing for comparative analysis.
Comprehensive analysis of different K fractions (bioavailable, exchangeable, non-exchangeable) using multiple extraction methods.
Inclusion of various fertilization treatments, including organic and mineral sources, and a control.
methodological_limitations: Soil samples for K changes were only taken at the beginning and end of the 21-year period, limiting detailed temporal trend analysis within the period.
The study only considered K content in the plough layer (0-30 cm), not accounting for K content in the subsoil, which can be a significant K source for plants.
The agreement between Mehlich 3 and NH4OAc methods might be lower in 'ordinary agricultural soils' compared to the specific long-term field trials studied.
Not all non-exchangeable K is plant-available or released at the same rate.
data_quality_assessment.data_completeness: Good, most required parameters are present.

measurement_precision.detection_limits: Not explicitly stated for K measurements.
measurement_precision.analytical_uncertainty: Not explicitly quantified (e.g., standard deviations or confidence intervals for means are not provided in the text, only means).

representativeness.spatial_representativeness: Two sites provide some spatial variability, but representativeness beyond these specific locations in the Czech Republic is not fully discussed.
representativeness.system_representativeness: The crop rotation and farming systems are stated to be representative of intensive farming in the Czech Republic.

uncertainty_sources: Potential for K mobilization from subsoil not accounted for in balance calculations.
Variability in nutrient content of organic fertilizers (FYM, straw) over the long term (average doses provided).
validation_evidence: Comparison of K saturation in CEC with satisfactory levels for Czech soils (Smatanová and Sušil 2018).
Comparison of non-exchangeable K contents with other long-term trials (Blake et al. 1999, Øgaard and Krogstad 2005).

key_methodological_references: Egnér H., Riehm H., Domingo W.R. (1960): Egner-Riehm method for K determination.
Mehlich A. (1984): Mehlich 3 soil test extractant.
Haby V.A., Russelle M.P., Skogley E.O. (1990): Ammonium acetate extraction.
Helmke P.A., Sparks D.L. (2000): Boiling HNO3 extraction.
Mader P., Száková J., Miholová D. (1998): Dry ashing of biological materials.
comparative_studies: Blake L. et al. (1999): Potassium content, uptake, and balance in European long-term field experiments.
Liu E. et al. (2010): Long-term effect of chemical fertilizer, straw, and manure on soil properties.
Srinivasarao Ch. et al. (2014): Potassium release characteristics, balance, and yield sustainability in long-term experiment.
Øgaard A.F., Krogstad T. (2005): Ability of different soil extraction methods to predict potassium release.
Binner I. et al. (2017): Potassium adsorption and release properties of clays in horticultural substrates.
literature_integration.theoretical_framework: The paper discusses the importance of non-exchangeable K for plant uptake, the role of rhizosphere acidification in K release (Hinsinger and Jaillard 1993, Steingrobe and Claasen 2000), and the binding of non-exchangeable K to 2:1 clay minerals (Brouder 2011).
benchmarking_data: Official assessment of K pool in CR for loamy soils (Smatanová and Sušil 2018).
Comparison of non-exchangeable K contents with Bad Lauchstadt and Rothamsted sites (Blake et al. 1999) and selected soils in Norway (Øgaard and Krogstad 2005).

extraction_metadata.data_richness_assessment: The paper is rich in quantitative data, especially regarding K balances, soil K fractions, and crop yields under various long-term fertilization treatments across two distinct sites.
potential_ambiguities: The exact number of experimental plots/replications for treatments is not explicitly stated, only 'four replications' for soil samples.

The units for total K extracted by boiling HNO3 in Table 5 are listed as 'mg K/ha' in the paper, but context suggests 'mg K/kg' is intended, aligning with other soil K measurements. Assumed 'mg K/kg' for consistency.
Standard errors or confidence intervals for most mean values are not provided in the text, only statistical significance (e.g., 'significant differences').
extraction_limitations: Inability to extract specific standard deviations or confidence intervals for most quantitative results, as they were not provided in the text.
recommended_validation_checks: Verify the intended units for the '100% HNO3 K' values in Table 5 with the authors or related publications if possible.

_usage_metadata.paper_id: Balance of potassium in two long-term field experiments with different fertilization treatments
